A function to implement a correlation heatmap including coefficients based on given numeric columns of a data frame.

cor_map.Rd

A function to implement a correlation heatmap including coefficients based on given numeric columns of a data frame.

cor_map(dataframe, num_col, col_scheme = "purpleorange")

Arguments

dataframe

The data frame to be used for EDA.
num_col

A vector of string of column names with numeric data from the data frame.
col_scheme

The color scheme of the heatmap desired, can only be one of the following: 'purpleorange', 'blueorange', 'redblue'. Defaults to 'purpleorange'.

Value

ggplot object; A correlation heatmap plot with correlation coefficient labels based on the numeric columns specified by user.

Examples

data <- data.frame(
SepalLengthCm = c(5.1, 4.9, 4.7),
SepalWidthCm = c(1.4, 1.4, 1.3),
PetalWidthCm = c(0.2, 0.1, 0.2),
Species = c('Iris-setosa','Iris-virginica', 'Iris-germanica')
)
numerical_columns <- c('SepalLengthCm','SepalWidthCm','PetalWidthCm')

cor_map(data, numerical_columns, col_scheme = 'purpleorange')
